cyclone.name: NATE
cyclone.current_location: about 170 mi SSE of Cabo Gracias a Dios on the Nicaragua/Honduras border
cyclone.trajectory: moving northwest across Central America, forecast to enter the north-western Caribbean, then accelerate northward across the Gulf of Mexico toward the central U.S. Gulf Coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: somewhere along the central Gulf Coast, most likely between eastern Louisiana and the Alabama/Florida border

weather_observation.watch_coast: None in effect for U.S. coastline yet (current warnings limited to Nicaragua–Honduras coast)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Sandy Bay Sirpi, Nicaragua to Punta Castilla, Honduras
weather_observation.impacted_coast: U.S. central Gulf Coast from southeast Louisiana through Mississippi, Alabama and the Florida Panhandle
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (35–45 kt) are possible at Pascagoula late Saturday night into Sunday, with a small chance of 50-kt gusts.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Early estimates suggest 3–5 ft of surge possible along the Mississippi coast, including Pascagoula.
weather_observation.rainfall: 4–8 inches of rain possible with locally higher totals, bringing flash-flood risk.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous rip currents and rough seas ahead of the storm; possible tornadoes in outer rain bands during landfall period.
